question: Which country houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Lut Desert"?
explanation: Iran houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Lut Desert". The Lut Desert, widely referred to as the Dasht-e Lut, is a large salt desert located in the provinces of Iran. It is the world's 25th-largest desert and was included on UNESCO's World Heritage List on July 17, 2016. The surface of its sand has been measured at temperatures as high as 70 Â°C, making it one of the world's driest and hottest places.
